00011 // Deal with SSL dependencies
00012 #include <openssl/crypto.h>
00013 #include <openssl/x509.h>
00014 #include <openssl/pem.h>
00015 #include <openssl/ssl.h>
00016 #include <openssl/err.h>

00018 namespace XmlRpc {
00019 
00021   class XmlRpcSource {
00022   public:
00026     XmlRpcSource(int fd = -1, bool deleteOnClose = false);
00027 
00029     virtual ~XmlRpcSource();
00030 
00032     int getfd() const { return _fd; }
00034     void setfd(int fd) { _fd = fd; }
00035 
00037     bool getKeepOpen() const { return _keepOpen; }
00039     void setKeepOpen(bool b=true) { _keepOpen = b; }
00040 
00042     virtual void close();
00043 
00045     virtual unsigned handleEvent(unsigned eventType) = 0;
00046 
00047     // Keep track of SSL status and other such things
00048     bool _ssl;
00049     SSL_CTX* _ssl_ctx;
00050     SSL* _ssl_ssl;
00051     SSL_METHOD* _ssl_meth;
00052   private:
00053 
00054     // Socket. This should really be a SOCKET (an alias for unsigned int*) on windows...
00055     int _fd;
00056 
00057     // In the server, a new source (XmlRpcServerConnection) is created
00058     // for each connected client. When each connection is closed, the
00059     // corresponding source object is deleted.
00060     bool _deleteOnClose;
00061 
00062     // In the client, keep connections open if you intend to make multiple calls.
00063     bool _keepOpen;
00064   };
00065 } // namespace XmlRpc
00066 
00067 #endif //_XMLRPCSOURCE_H_
